name: carbonizing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
carbonize
to change or be changed to carbon by burning, heating, or during fossilization (= the process of being preserved in rock over a long period): Coal beds are vast deposits of carbonized vegetable matter. Grease will build up and carbonize on the bottom of the pan. Brown the steak but try not to carbonize it.
More examplesFewer examplesHe analyzed carbonized scraps of fabric from the burial site.Get the pan really hot and briefly carbonize the outside of the fish.Several large pieces of partially carbonisedcarbonized wood were found.Any food stuck to the grill will have carbonisedcarbonized .
